data.title: â€œPunk Goes Taylor Swiftâ€ â€” A Tracklist Straight From Our Emo Swiftie Dreams
data.meta_description: We need "Punk Goes Taylor Swift" to be a reality so badly. Think of all the emo Swifties out there who would thrive with an album like this!
data.text:
We had so much fun dreaming up a â€œPunk Goes Noah Kahanâ€ tracklist that we had to keep it going. And what better artistâ€™s discography is there to create a â€œPunk Goesâ€¦â€ album with than Taylor Swift? With 11 albums ranging in sound, genre, and theme, we had a whole host of songs to choose from. Honestly, it was pretty hard to choose and we had to reel it in at a certain point because this list got LONG. â€œPunk Goes Taylor Swiftâ€ could be an entire series focused on each individual album alone! Who knows, maybe weâ€™ll just release a â€œPunk Goes Taylor Swiftâ€ (Deluxe Edition) soon.

While some Taylor Swift songs are pop-punk coded and would lend themselves easily to a cover, some of the song/artist combos on our list are the result of our imagination and the style of the artist. Weâ€™d love to see what some of them can do with the tracks weâ€™ve given them! And thereâ€™s a whole group of fans out there who categorize themselves as â€œemo Swiftiesâ€ (swemos?) so it was just meant to be.

So without further ado, letâ€™s dive into our dream â€œPunk Goes Taylor Swiftâ€ tracklist:

â€˜The Great Warâ€™ â€” Grayscale

Okay, full disclosure. This article kinda came into existence purely because we have a vision of Grayscale absolutely killing a cover of â€˜The Great War.â€™ We just think that the song would translate beautifully into their style, something reminiscent of the Umbra or Nella Vita eras. Itâ€™s an idea that we cannot get out of our heads and itâ€™s honestly why we started thinking up all of these other possible cover combinations so likeâ€¦ shoutout to Grayscale for that! Just let us know who we have to beg to make this happen pls.

â€˜Better Than Revengeâ€™ â€” Stand Atlantic

Tell us Stand Atlantic isnâ€™t the perfect choice for this song, come on. Oh, whatâ€™s that? You canâ€™t? Thatâ€™s right because they ARE. They would bring the loud, fast-paced, intense energy that this song needs and we just know they would capture the vibes perfectly. Opening up the pit to â€˜Better Than Revengeâ€™ at a Stand Atlantic show is not a need but a want.

â€˜Cruel Summerâ€™ â€” The Maine

Surprise! This one actually already exists! The Maine did a cover of â€˜Cruel Summerâ€™ last year so we donâ€™t actually have to work too hard to imagine what their version of the song would sound like! They took a softer, slower approach to the track, showcasing their own style and putting a different spin on it. When translating a song from one genre to another it can actually be kind of fun to see how the artists decide to switch it up so we love that The Maine took that route. We wonder what they would do with other Taylor Swift songs ğŸ¤”

â€˜I Can Do It With A Broken Heartâ€™ â€” Between You & Me

On that note, we can imagine Between You & Me taking â€˜I Can Do It With A Broken Heart,â€™ which is pure upbeat pop, and turning it into a pop-punk masterpiece. â€œIâ€™m a real tough kid, I can handle my sh*tâ€ feels like a fitting lyric for BYAM to take on and we would actually really love hearing their version of â€˜ICDIWABH.â€™

â€˜The Bolterâ€˜ â€” Trophy Eyes

â€˜The Bolterâ€™ is definitely different from Trophy Eyesâ€™ sound but thatâ€™s why itâ€™s so good. A reimagined version of this song in Trophy Eyesâ€™ style? Yes, please. If you think about it, â€˜The Bolterâ€™ and â€˜Runaway Come Homeâ€™ by Trophy Eyes are cousins, sisters even. So it only makes sense that they cover the song.

â€˜no body no crimeâ€™ â€” Knuckle Puck and Real Friends

Sorry to anyone tired of us pushing the KP/RF bromance agenda but youâ€™ll have to pry it from our cold dead hands. Speaking of dead, the â€˜no body, no crimeâ€™ duet would make the perfect track for them to cover. 1) Itâ€™s a duet, so they can stay together and 2) we just want to see what they would do with it because of how sonically different â€˜no body, no crimeâ€™ is from the usual pop-punk style. Honorable mention that we also considered giving to them is â€˜Hits Different.â€™ You can see the vision, right?

â€˜Cleanâ€™ â€” Movements

Thematically, â€˜Cleanâ€™ just feels like the right choice for Movements. We imagine them turning this song into something reminiscent of the Feel Something era. Slow, emotional, and with some killer guitar riffs. They would make this song sound absolutely amazing and the more we think about it the more we need it actually. We canâ€™t even elaborate because we feel like the pairing just says everything it needs to.

â€˜The Story Of Usâ€™ â€” Broadside

If Broadside covered â€˜The Story Of Usâ€™ live, we could imagine the energy on stage with Oliver Baxxter jumping all over the place, high-energy guitars, and insane vocal runs. Weâ€™re imagining a sound similar to something from Hotel Bleu but weâ€™re also imagining the Old Bones era. Is it just us? Speak Now has always been a very pop-punk-coded album in our opinion so it kind of makes sense tbh.

â€˜Now That We Donâ€™t Talkâ€™ â€” Taylor Acorn

Taylor Acorn is Taylor Swiftâ€™s name twin and her sound honestly kind of gives us â€œTaylor Swift Goes Pop Punkâ€ vibes anyway so likeâ€¦ of course sheâ€™s on our list! We can feel it in our bones that â€˜Now That We Donâ€™t Talkâ€™ would be an amazing song for her to cover. We can hear her turning the entire outro of this track into something all her own and we can kind of see thematic parallels too. We imagine Taylor Acorn translating â€˜Now That We Donâ€™t Talkâ€™ into â€˜Greenerâ€™sâ€™ pettier older sister with the outro and itâ€™s everything.

â€˜Bad Bloodâ€˜ â€” As It Is

As It Is please come home we miss you. We so badly want to see them covering â€˜Bad Blood,â€™ perhaps in the style of The Great Depression era. Maybe theyâ€™d decide to do the Kendrick Lamar version and tap another vocalist in and turn it into a duet, who knows? We just know that we need to hear it.

â€˜Iâ€™m Only Me When Iâ€™m With Youâ€™ â€” The Summer Set

This is another cover on our list that already exists! The Summer Set has covered quite a few Taylor Swift songs so we had a few to pick from but this is one of our favorite Taylor songs so we decided to go with it. We donâ€™t even have to say much about how we imagine theyâ€™d tackle it because they already have! Maybe we can convince them to do an â€˜Iâ€™m Only Me When Iâ€™m With Youâ€™ (The Summer Setâ€™s Version) once Taylor re-records Debut!

â€˜Mr. Perfectly Fineâ€™ â€” State Champs

â€˜Mr. Perfectly Fineâ€™ is perfectly (ha ha) paced for State Champs to match the energy. They could totally turn the song into something of their own and we think Derekâ€™s vocals work the best for it. Why? Couldnâ€™t tell you, itâ€™s simply ~vibes~ (but weâ€™re still right).

â€˜Mineâ€˜ â€” Armâ€™s Length

This pick is sort of official? There isnâ€™t any official recorded versions but Armâ€™s Length did cover â€˜Mineâ€™ a while back while they were on tour (and we got to participate in the pit that opened up during it hehe). Again, we donâ€™t need to imagine what they would do with the song but why not make it official and drop a recording?

â€˜Our Songâ€™ â€” Bearings

The more we think about it, the more we love the idea of Bearings covering â€˜Our Song.â€™ Maybe theyâ€™d up the tempo a little, maybe theyâ€™d stay closer to the original, heck maybe theyâ€™d go the acoustic route, but whatever they would do, â€˜Our Songâ€™ is the right fit. We can picture Dougie Cousins jumping around on stage while singing this cover too.

â€˜Wouldâ€™ve, Couldâ€™ve, Shouldâ€™veâ€™ â€” We Are The In Crowd

Do this: listen to â€˜The Best Thing (That Never Happened)â€™ by We Are The In Crowd and then imagine them covering â€˜Wouldâ€™ve, Couldâ€™ve, Shouldâ€™veâ€™ and we promise youâ€™ll see our vision. WATIC would be able to capture the intensity of this song by turning it into something that sounds similar to â€˜The Best Thing.â€™ Not to mention, hearing â€œgive me back my girlhood it was mine firstâ€ sung with the intensity and production of a pop-punk track might actually heal us a little bit.

â€˜Call It What You Wantâ€™ â€” Waterparks

Waterparks may have a serial killer in the band but weâ€™re still putting them on this list pending more information (/j). In all seriousness, if you think about it you can kind of hear how this might sound in Awstenâ€™s voice no? They would kill (no pun intended) this cover if they did it in their sound.

â€˜The Prophecyâ€™ â€” Honey Revenge

Honey Revenge could have also covered one of Taylorâ€™s more upbeat tracks but something about them covering â€˜The Prophecyâ€™ and making it sound similar to â€˜Sensitiveâ€™ has stuck itself in our brains and wonâ€™t leave. And like, we really wanted to include â€˜The Prophecyâ€™ on this list. And, of course, we had to include our fellow bee-themed band too. HRâ€™s style and Devin Papadolâ€™s vocals just feel like the perfect combination for a track like this and we would love it if this ever became a reality one day.

â€˜Stay Stay Stayâ€™ â€” Young Culture

Young Culture turning â€˜Stay, Stay, Stayâ€™ into a fast-paced pop-punk song would be everything. Thatâ€™s it, thatâ€™s the tweet. â€˜Stay, Stay, Stayâ€™ is fun, quirky, and lighthearted and we feel like it matches YCâ€™s vibe perfectly. Theyâ€™re one of the nicest and most fun bands we know and their cover would be an all-around good time.

â€˜The Way I Loved Youâ€™ â€” The Story So Far

If you know anything about The Story So Far at all you might be giggling along with us at this pick but likeâ€¦ Theyâ€™re an iconic staple in the pop-punk scene so weâ€™re going to include them. Their cover would sound absolutely nothing like the original but if it did that would be kind of iconic tbh. â€˜The Way I Loved Youâ€™ thematically would bring enough angst for TSSF to turn it into a cover considering the angsty parallels in their own discography.

â€˜Treacherousâ€™ â€” Against The Current

Against The Current is one of those bands that we feel deserves ALL the hype and given their sound, â€˜Treacherousâ€™ just feels like the right choice for them to cover. Chrissy Costanza has the perfect vocals for this song and we imagine the bridge of â€˜Treacherousâ€™ sounding something like â€˜Gravityâ€™ the more we think about it. This might be one of our favorite picks on this entire list tbh.

If youâ€™re still here 20 songs later, we salute you. But if youâ€™re a Taylor Swift fan thatâ€™s probably what youâ€™re used to. Either way, weâ€™re glad you stuck around and we hope you enjoyed our list!

Like we said, Taylor has such an expansive discography that choosing these songs was so hard. There are eras, tracks, and artists we didnâ€™t even hit even though theyâ€™d be perfect for this list. That being said, weâ€™re sure this mightâ€™ve sparked some ideas of your own about â€œPunk Goes Taylor Swiftâ€ covers youâ€™d like to see come to life. Drop us a comment below or find us on our socials and tell us what covers youâ€™d want to see on an album like this! Weâ€™re always buzzing about something on Twitter, Instagram, or Facebook.

We have plenty more Taylor Swift and pop punk news for you too so be sure to check it out!
